intro: Melampyrum moravicum, commonly known as the Moravian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture.
